title: Fan, ca. 1730
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Robertson D. Ward, from the collection of her mother, Mrs. Helen Wright-Clark Dawson
description: Pleated fan. Front and back leaves of painted paper; sticks of ivory with carved mother-of-pearl inlays on the guards; mother-of-pearl thumb guard and washer at the rivet. Flora, the Roman goddess of flowers and of the spring, is at the center of the leaf. She is presented with baskets of flowers, watered by a stream of running water personified by the figure at the right. The back of the fan is decorated with an enlarged image of the spring flowers received by Flora.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, ca. 1730.
ca. 1730. Medium: paper, ivory
Technique: painted. Gift of Mrs. Robertson D. Ward, from the collection of her mother, Mrs. Helen Wright-Clark Dawson. 1970-58-24.
